div.pre: 1474 Galatia, district of Famagusta, 1939 Burial: c. 170 B.C. (M) Contents: 123 AR. Pot hoard Ptolemy I: 12 tetradr. (Alexandreia) Ptolemy II: 57 tetradr. (Alexandreia 7, Joppa 2, Ace 11, Tyre 17, Sidon 7, Cyprus? 12, unc. mint 1, pl.) Ptolemy III: 7 tetradr. (Alexandreia 1, Ace 2, Tyre 1, Tarsus 1, Ptolemais- Lebedus 1, Aenus 1) Ptolemy IV: 7 tetradr. (Cyrene? 1, Tyre 1, Sidon 1, unc. mints 4) Ptolemy V:15 tetradr. (Sidon 1, Berytus 1, Damascus? 1, unc. mints 12) Ptolemy VI: 16 tetradr. (Alexandreia 8, Cyprus 8) Unc. kings and mints: 9 Disposition: Nicosia Wilson, Report of the Department of Antiquities, Cyprus, 1937-1939, p. 204 The bronze coin mentioned may be the core of a pl. tetradr.
